edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security
Class PasswordManager

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.security.PasswordManager
public class PasswordManager
extends java.lang.Object

Uses Diffie-Hellman to exchange secretes that are used as passwords. The ideal is a secure single sign on, so we can have easy-to-setup security. If we use Basic Authentication, it is inherently insecure, to wihch we can mitigate with a crytp/MD5, which also reduces the problem of storing my secure on another person's computer. But we should use Digest Authentication, which requires recoerable password on the server side. We do not want to transfer such secret in clear text, so we use Diffie-Hellman to generate such secrets. The problem is, it is a shared secret between a pair, so the pie can no longer just use one secret (my secret) to authenticate into everyone. Now the proxy has to use the many secrets to authenticate into every other person. This is acceptable, and maybe desirable, since we do not want to store our secrets into others. TODO: security: protocol: this needs a revisit once we are more familiar with PKI.

Author:
Jie Ren
